intro: Tithymalus chrysophyllus, commonly known as the goldenleaf tithymalus, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Europe. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers arranged in umbels, typical of its family. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full sunlight. Its ornamental value comes from its delicate foliage and prolonged flowering period.
